intro: Ecbolium leptanthum, commonly known as the slender false heath, is a member of the Ericaceae family. It is a shrub-like plant characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red or purple in color. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
